Question: Narrowest pa of uterine tube is: March 2013
Choices:
  A: Infundibulum
  B: Ampulla
  C: Isthmus
  D: Interstitial
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Explanation:
I answered the question incorrectly because I confused the fallopian tube with the uterine tube. The fallopian tube has three parts: infundibulum, ampulla, and isthmus, while the uterine tube has two parts: the isthmus and the interstitial part. The narrowest part of the uterine tube is the interstitial part, which is the part that passes through the uterine wall.
